pub_created_display: Ardashir I (224 to 240), AE/3, Group / Mint B ("Hamadan")
issue_place_s: Group / Mint B ("Hamadan"), Media, Sasanian Empire
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: crown cap edged with a double row of pearls, eagle in the center of lateral field, holding diadem ribbon in his beak; diadem; pendent diadem ribbons; cheek flaps; tunica; row of pearls froom the shoulder to the breast; dotted border
issue_obverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o.  mzdysn bgy 'rthštr MRKAn MRKA 'ry'n- MNW ctry yzd'n| mazdēsn bay Ardašir šāhān šāh Ērān kē čihr az yazdān | "the Mazda-worshiping, divine Ardashir, King of Kings of the Iranians, whose image / brilliance is from the gods"
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; round altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical strokes; to the left and right mushroom-shaped bases supporting lion-paw structures; below left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbonbelow left and right edge of altar table pendent diadem ribbon; dotted border
issue_reverse_legend_s: 11 h l. o. NWRA ZY, 2 h l. i. 'rthštr | ādur ī Ardašīr | “the fire of Ardashir”
